page.title: 04Scalebyhill Village
page.content: The only residential area in the block is Scalebyhill.This is a small group of stone cottages, terraced brick houses and more modern homes. There are more houses, old and new, along the road South of the village. Some of the owners work in the area. Others commute to urban areas to work, or have retired to live in the country There are two possible reasons why Scalebyhill is here. Most of the houses are close to the road passing through the village.Now it peters out, but may once have been a busier thor- oughfare. Or the village may have gathered around the Methodist chapel, built in an open field in 1828(see page 5).
